title: How Many Calories in One Cup of Sugar?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in one cup of sugar—about 774 kcal—plus full nutrition breakdown, carbs, and variations for baking or dieting.
h1: How Many Calories in One Cup of Sugar?
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 cup ≈ 200 g (level, unsifted).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by sugar type (white, brown, powdered), packing density, and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of granulated sugar provides ~774 kcal, entirely from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to brown sugar (packed, per cup ≈220 g)
Use powdered sugar (sifted, per cup ≈120 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in one cup of sugar?
faqs.a: Approximately 774 kcal for 1 cup granulated white sugar.

faqs.q: Is all the calories in sugar from carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, 100% from carbohydrates—200 g carbs in one cup, all sugars.

faqs.q: How much sugar is in one cup?
faqs.a: About 200 g of granulated sugar, equivalent to 50 teaspoons.

faqs.q: Does brown sugar have more calories per cup?
faqs.a: Yes, packed brown sugar is denser (~220 g per cup), adding ~75 kcal more.
Lower at ~387 kcal per cup due to lighter density (~120 g).
